title: Kimchi chicken

ingredients.content: 600 - 700 g chicken breasts, cut into slices (1 cm)
3 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into pieces
400 - 500 g kimchi, cut into bite-size pieces, with juices (see Tips)
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, for garnishing
sambal oelek, to serve (optional - see Tips)

preparations.content: Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh rice into it. Rinse rice until water runs clear. Place water and salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with rice and cook <b>14 min/100°C/speed 4<b>. Transfer rice into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh chicken, soy sauce, sesame oil and brown sugar into it. Stir to combine, then set aside.
Place ginger, spring onions/shallots and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add carrot and reserved marinated chicken and cook <b>10 min/120°C//speed 1<b>.
Divide reserved rice between serving bowls and top with chicken. Garnish with coriander leaves and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. Serve with sambal oelek (optional) on the side.

hintsAndTricks: Kimchi, a staple in Korean cuisine, is a traditional side dish made from salted and fermented vegetables, most commonly Napa cabbage and Korean radishes, with a variety of seasonings including chilli powder, scallions, garlic and ginger. You can find it in the international aisle of most major supermarkets and at Asian food stores. To make your own kimchi, refer to the recipes available on Recipe Community.

Sambal oelek is a spicy paste, popular in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore and Sri Lanka. It's used both in cooking and as a condiment with a variety of dishes. You can find it in the international aisle of most major supermarkets and at Asian food stores.
